title: How the new Conqueror actually works:

However its splash might give a stack if it bounces to another champion depending on how its coded i guess.

Where can I find all this please? xD
I mean, I didn't know there was an effect classification of "modifier" "unique source of damage". I would like to find out where you found all that, Unless it's in the game's code which I really don't want to see. xD
So by the logic of this, if I hit someone twice, then proc luden on someone else I will get the electro proc on the first person with the bounce. Nice

Ability damage is the damage type inflicted by almost all abilities.  

Fizz's Urchin Strike is noteworthy for applying both basic attack damage and ability damage.

Ability damage will apply spell effects, including spell vamp.

Some abilities grant the champion bonus ability damage on their attacks. 

As a standard, however, most effects that trigger on a champion's basic attacks (including those sourced from an ability) deal on-hit damage.

Some abilities modify the champion's attacks to deal ability damage.

Most spell effects inflict ability damage, allowing them to trigger other spell effects (excluding itself).

Spell effect (like ludens or those from masteries or burns/dot) would not count as it's own 'damage type' because it doesnt do dmg on ots own and is for all intents and purposes part of the ability.

It's like how when you auto attack, you can crit and do additional damage from bork. But those arent three hits. It's just one AA. 

A spell+luden+burn is still one spell.
